data.title: Template:Did you know nominations/WBCM
data.text:
The following is an archived discussion of the DYK nomination of the article below. Please do not modify this page. Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as this nomination's talk page, the article's talk page or Wikipedia talk:Did you know), unless there is consensus to re-open the discussion at this page. No further edits should be made to this page.

The result was: promoted by Allen3 talk 17:26, 29 August 2015 (UTC)

WBCM-LP

[edit]

... that radio station WBCM-LP is a working exhibit inside of The Birthplace of Country Music museum?

ALT1:... that WBCM-LP, located in The Birthplace of Country Music museum, is a working radio station exhibit?

ALT2:... that radio station WBCM-LP is part of a working exhibit at The Birthplace of Country Music museum located in Bristol, Virginia?

Reviewed: Template:Did you know nominations/Adam Stansfield

Created/expanded by Neutralhomer (talk). Self-nominated at 23:36, 18 August 2015 (UTC).

New article of more than sufficient length, created and nominated on the same day, citations are plentiful, and hook facts are properly cited, interesting, and of proper length. Tone is neutral and close paraphrasing appears to have been avoided. QPQ checks out. Good to go for all three hooks but I have a strong preference for ALT2. - Dravecky (talk) 09:37, 29 August 2015 (UTC)

ALT2 works fine for me, I have no preference over any of the hooks. :) - Neutralhomer • Talk • 14:39, 29 August 2015 (UTC)
